review: This thing is the most archaic piece of crap I have ever used.  Apple should be ashamed to put their name on this garbage.  I own several iPads, and several iPhones.  I am a huge fan of Apple products, so thought the Apple TV would be a great addition.  WRONG.  The remote looks and functions like something out of about 1983.  But by far the worst part of all is the Apple TV has a mind of its own.  Frequently (meaning several times a week) will not connect to the internet, despite being wired direct to my router via ethernet cable (I tried wireless, it was exponentially worse).  Sometimes it won't work on startup, other times it will just cut off mid-movie and stop working.  Restart sometimes works, sometimes not.  Absolute piece of garbage.  Wish Kindle TV would have been available when I got this.  Lesson learned.  Thankfully Amazon has phenomenal customer service.  I am going to try a new Apple TV unit (would much rather get the Kindle TV, but since I own so many iTunes movies, would really be nice if the Apple TV worked), and will report back if that one works any better.  But so far with all my Apple products....everything else A+...Apple TV...F-
author: Matthew Dunham "wildfan"

review: This product works fine.  The case and remote are made well and of metal.  I also bought a ruku around the same time. My students say they use their iphones and I touches to control their apple tv's - instead of the stock remote
